image.altText: A sign for the Youth Court in Adelaide

props.synopsis: A teenager involved in the ambush of men lured into fake sexual encounters via social media — including threats over a degrading video — has avoided convictions for his "vigilante" crimes.

title.children: Teen sentenced for role in 'vigilante' ambush attacks on men

image.altText: Firefighters and police standing on a beach in front of rocks, holding a green plastic sheet

props.synopsis: A 29-year-old man has died after he was found floating in waters off O'Sullivan Beach in Adelaide's south on Thursday, police say.

title.children: Man, 29, drowns off O'Sullivan Beach in Adelaide's south

image.altText: Damage to a causeway along the South Australian coast.

props.synopsis: While wild weather has caused damage to coastal areas, the rain has brought some relief to farmers — but they say far more will be needed to break the drought.

title.children: Storm damages historic causeway but farmers still await 'miraculous recovery'

image.altText: A woman speaks at a dais in front of a corrugated iron wall inside a buildikng

props.synopsis: Danni Smith has appeared in court charged with assaulting a current or former partner. She says she will fight the charges and they have nothing to do with the Voice.

title.children: SA Voice to Parliament joint leader on domestic violence charges

image.altText: Parts of a regional highway that shows both sealed roads and washed away portions

props.synopsis: Businesses and pastoral stations in the Channel Country region of far-north-east South Australia could be stranded for up to eight months, after Cooper Creek's only barge was taken away for servicing two years ago.

title.children: Residents still cut off by floodwater angry over lack of planning

image.altText: A woman signing Auslan in front of a colourful flag with a lit up stage in the distance

props.synopsis: While familiar at emergency announcements and press conferences, Auslan interpreters are now becoming increasingly common at concerts.

title.children: It can take hours to prepare for one show but it's a 'joyous' task, says Auslan interpreter

image.altText: A black and white photo of a man in a cap wearing a black shirt with thick metal necklaces smiling in a gym.

props.synopsis: The ATO is taking legal action against founder of popular gym chain Derrimut 24:7 Nikolaos Solomos, over an alleged multi-million-dollar tax debt.

title.children: Gym chain owner once shot at by rivals facing $11 million tax bill

image.altText: Two cars parked outside a building with sign 'Little Shining Stars Early Learning Centre', a parent walks out of glass doors

props.synopsis: Parents at an Adelaide early learning centre under investigation have shared mixed views, as data reveals a number of centres have failed to comply with national laws since June.

title.children: Parents of Klemzig early learning centre speak out amid investigation

image.altText: Dad of patient looks through an octogon shape beaming at the camera

props.synopsis: A South Australian theatre group has devised a new show, The Lensical, that provides young long-term patients with a thrilling bedside spectacle.

title.children: This beautiful performance takes place at the end of a hospital bed

image.altText: Ben Keays

props.synopsis: The AFL fines Ben Keays and Josh Rachele after the two Adelaide players repeatedly ignored directions to not wear metal studs on their boots.

title.children: Crows players fined after ignoring directions to not wear metal studs

image.altText: Donald Trump, with blood smeared on his face, raises his fist triumphantly in the air as the US flag flies high

props.synopsis: As the anniversary of the attempted assassination of Donald Trump looms, the deputy director of the Secret Service reveals six personnel were suspended following the incident — but no employees will face termination.

title.children: Secret Service staff suspended over attempted Trump assassination

image.altText: Trump looking angry holding a folder with papers that have his signature

props.synopsis: The ruling means the US Supreme Court will likely have the ultimate say on whether the US president's executive order was lawful.

title.children: Court blocks Trump's birthright citizenship ban for illegal migrants

image.altText: a man behind the bar of a pub

props.synopsis: Pubs, cafes and restaurants are legally restructuring to wipe their debts and stay open, as the hospitality industry continues to battle tough trading conditions.

title.children: 22 cents to the $1: How a pub legally wiped debt and stayed open

image.altText: A large blaze burning on the top storey of a tall apartment complex.

props.synopsis: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy says he has received "all necessary political signals" from the US that American military aid will be resumed.

title.children: Russia pummels Kyiv, allies pledge 'coalition of the willing' HQ in Paris

image.altText: Anthony Albanese close up

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese has nominated "affordable child care" as the legacy he wants to leave. It's all the more surprising, then, that the government didn't seem to spot a plethora of problems in an area so central to the prime minister's ambitions.

title.children: Child care is the canary in the coalmine for wider policy delivery problems

image.altText: The original Birkin bag on top of black glass display case.

props.synopsis: The bag was created for the late actress Jane Birkin.

title.children: Fashion brand Hermès's original Birkin bag sells for $15.2 million at auction

image.altText: Protestors hold up signs which read "Survivors deserve better".

props.synopsis: Allowing sexual assault survivors to pre-record their testimony ahead of trial may mitigate the negative health impacts many experience as a result of the court process, experts say.

title.children: Sexual assault survivors call for change to 'traumatising' court process

image.altText: A tight close-up of a white man with a beard and moustache - Zacahary Rolfe - with a stern expression, frowning.

props.synopsis: Former Northern Territory police officer Zachary Rolfe is considering an appeal of findings he was "racist" and ignored his training before fatally shooting an Aboriginal teenager in 2019.

title.children: Zachary Rolfe in bid for 'rare' appeal in Kumanjayi Walker inquest

image.altText: Amanda Anisimova waves to the crowd at Wimbledon.

props.synopsis: An inspired Amanda Anisimova tears up the script to defeat world number one Aryna Sabalenka, while Iga Świątek advances to her first Wimbledon final.

title.children: Fearless Anisimova topples Sabalenka to reach Wimbledon final

image.altText: Dr Suhana Mohd has her back facing the camera. She is wearing a flower printed hijab and is facing her work computer.

props.synopsis: A major study reveals concerning levels of Islamophobia and discrimination experienced by Muslim healthcare professionals in Australia. Experts are calling it a hidden crisis.

title.children: Doctors face Islamophobia in Australian healthcare 'crisis'

image.altText: A close up of a Hesta sign on a wall.

props.synopsis: A HESTA executive says there is 'no systemic issue' at super fund, despite some members still waiting to access their money and a "small number" of contributions misdirected.

title.children: 'Appalling': Consumer advocate slams super fund HESTA

image.altText: x-ray

props.synopsis: How closely were you following the news this week? Time to find out!

title.children: Weekly news quiz: A new US political party, Piastri penalised and a cat's shock X-ray

image.altText: A close up photo of Donald Trump speaking to reporters at a cabinet table.

props.synopsis: This week in politics Donald Trump was vague on tariffs, Sussan Ley got another glossy profile and Anthony Albanese prepared for his trip to China.

title.children: Jim Chalmers wanted to talk about the RBA. Donald Trump had other ideas

image.altText: Ms Segal leans on a lectern speaking, Mr Albanese watches behind her.

props.synopsis: Powers to strip funding from public institutions who fail on antisemitism, a review of Australia's hate speech laws, and visa screening for antisemitic views are among the recommendations of a wide-ranging report launched by Prime Minister Anthony Albanese this morning.

title.children: Antisemitism plan would strip funding from unis, arts events who fail to fight Jewish hate

image.altText: A woman holds her phone in front of her while standing in front of a large TikTok sign on a wall

props.synopsis: The latest move by the European regulator follows an investigation that resulted in the company receiving a massive fine for transferring data to China.

title.children: TikTok being investigated for storing user data in China

image.altText: Ruth, who has Down Syndrome, looking at the camera smiling wearing a shirt with flowers on it and glasses with tied brown hair

props.synopsis: Ruth Faragher, who lives with Down syndrome, says support workers need to know when to step in and when to let a person do things themselves.

title.children: Research into safety becoming restrictive for adults with intellectual disability

image.altText: Brisbane Lions player Kai Lohmann grins at the crowd as he stands in celebration after kicking a goal.

props.synopsis: The defending premiers Brisbane secure second spot ahead of a round of top-eight clashes but they lose one of their trusted defenders to a potentially season-ending Achilles injury.

title.children: Lions keep control of second spot with Blues win, but lose defender

image.altText: Jack O'Brien and dad Jon.

props.synopsis: The mother of Australian man Jack O'Brien says she doesn't believe Russia will accept responsibility any time soon for the death of her son in the Malaysia Airlines downing.

title.children: 'He was on his way home to us': MH17 family reacts to court finding

image.altText: A smiling young blonde woman sits with a drink on a patio in the sunshine.

props.synopsis: Jurors in the Victorian Supreme Court trial of Lachlan Young, who is accused of murdering Hannah McGuire in April 2024, have visited several locations allegedly linked to her death.

title.children: Jury visits house where Hannah McGuire was allegedly murdered

image.altText: A body of water in the middle of a gorge, with blue sky overhead.

props.synopsis: Police divers have located the body of a 57-year-old man after he slipped beneath the water while swimming at Edith Falls, near Katherine.

title.children: Police recover body of tourist from popular NT swimming spot

image.altText: Penny Wong stands at a lectern with an image of an Australian flag in the background.

props.synopsis: Foreign Minister Penny Wong promises South-East Asian nations that Australia will be a "reliable" partner with open markets, as the region grapples with the Trump administration's aid cuts and tariff threats.

title.children: 'Reliable partner': Penny Wong's message to Asian nations amid Trump tariff threats

image.altText: Ralph Leroy Menzies during his competency hearing in November last year.

props.synopsis: The Utah man, who is convicted of murder, elected to be executed by firing squad in the 1980s.

title.children: How Utah laws have enabled a man with dementia to be executed by firing squad

image.altText: A small pygmy hippo opens her mouth

props.synopsis: Crowds have been invited to a four-day festival at the Thai zoo where Moo Deng frolicked to stardom.

title.children: Thailand's famous hippo, Moo Deng, celebrates her first birthday
